001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.util;
002
003/**
004 * Represents an operation that accepts three input arguments and performs an action.
005 *
006 * <p>This functional interface is similar to {@link java.util.function.BiConsumer}, but it
007 * supports three parameters instead of two. It is primarily used for handling operations
008 * that require three input parameters in a functional manner.
009 *
010 * <p>The first argument, {@code T}, represents the primary entity involved in the operation.
011 * The second argument, {@code U}, provides contextual information or additional parameters.
012 * The third argument, {@code K}, captures supplementary data relevant to the action.
013 *
014 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate ğŸ’ğŸ‘¨ğŸ’»
015 */
016@FunctionalInterface
017public interface TriConsumer<T, U, K> {
018
019   /**
020    * Performs the operation given the specified inputs.
021    *
022    * @param t The first input argument.
023    * @param u The second input argument.
024    * @param k The third input argument.
025    */
026   void accept(T t, U u, K k);
027}
